bill_title: prohibit the transfer of alcoholic beverage licenses under certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the transfer of alcoholic beverage licenses under certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-2-6.2 be amended to read as follows: 35-2-6.2. Any licensee under this title, with the exception of a solicitor, must shall be a person of good moral character, never convicted of a felony, and, if a corporation, the managing officers thereof must shall have like qualifications. No person may transfer any license under this title to any other person in order to evade or circumvent the good moral character standard required by this section. No person may transfer any license under this title to any other person subsequent to a felony conviction or while under arrest or indictment on a felony charge. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
